intro: Lellingeria aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
